hints.content:
All of the circles show $\dfrac13$ shaded.  

However, for two fractions to be equivalent, they must refer to the same size whole.
Which answer choice shows $\dfrac13$ of the same size wholes shaded?

This  pair of circles shows equivalent areas shaded:

[[☃ image 1]]

$=$

[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: Two same-sized circles separated by an equal sign. The first circle has one out of three equal parts shaded. The second circle has one out of three equal parts shaded. !
Two same-sized circles separated by an equal sign. The first circle has one out of three equal parts shaded. The second circle has one out of three equal parts shaded. !

question.content:
**Which pair of circles have equivalent areas shaded?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![Two differently-sized circles separated by an equal sign. The first circle is big and has one out of three equal parts shaded.
